description: A hotel cleaner keeps the lobby in good shape. He also cares for the birds in there.
title: The Lovebirds Are Part of the Job
title_page: The Lovebirds Are Part of the Job - The New York Times
text:
Errol Lindsay, 50, is a cleaner at Newport Beachside Hotel and Resort in Miami Beach , Fla.
What do you do at work?
I clean the public spaces and the lobby, including the windows and the floors. I work alone on the morning shift, from 6:30 a.m. to 3 p.m. It’s not part of my job, but if I see someone struggling with a box or a suitcase, whether a co-worker or a guest, I’ll lend a hand. I also take care of the eight lovebirds — the parrots — in the lobby.
How did you start caring for the birds?
I’ve always liked animals. I grew up in Jamaica, where my family raised donkeys and horses on our farm.
My wife and I emigrated to the United States 15 years ago, and when I started this job, I was immediately attracted to the birds. The four blue, green and yellow ones remind me of the Jamaican flag.
